Press and media round up. As always take each story with a pinch of salt BUT as a broken clock is right twice a day just maybe a journalist might get something right.
---------------------------------

After signing his new deal Spurs manager Mauricio Pochettino has moved quickly to try and secure his transfer targets with Manchester Uniteds Martial top of his wish list.

(Daily Mirror)
---------------------------------

Mauricio Pochettino is now the 3rd highest paid manager in the Premier League behind only Pep Guardiola and Jose Mourinho.

(Daily Mirror)
---------------------------------

Spurs want Ryan Sessgnon, De Light and one over major signing this summer.

(The Sun)
---------------------------------

Spurs and Manchester United have begun negotiations for Toby Alderweireld. United hope to pay £40m with Spurs demanding a fee in excess of £60m to allow him to join their league rivals.

(The Sun)
---------------------------------

Victor Wanyama has rubbished reports he is leaving Tottenham claiming he is very happy at the club and the manager values him. He has withdrawn from international duty so he can have a full summer break and then head into the new season fully fit unlike last year.

(Sky Sports News)
---------------------------------

Manchester United want to complete the signing ofToby Alderweireld from Tottenham before the World Cup starts next month.

(The Times)
---------------------------------

Pochettino has signed his new deal only due to a 'gentlemans agreement' he can leave for Real Madrid or PSG should they come calling.

(Marca)
---------------------------------

Tottenham manager Mauricio Pochettino still wants to bring Zaha to Tottenham from Crystal Palace.

(Daily Mail)
---------------------------------

Man Utd officials are said to be shocked at Tottenham's asking price for Toby Alderweirled with Daniel Levy pointing to the price Liverpool paid for VVD in January.

(Express)
---------------------------------

All stories taken from the press 25th May 2018.
